title: lower priority queue
body:
hey i always thought that if you had been good for a few months that when you happen to go into priority que you would start at waiting for 5 mins again.
because i just recently got in to the lower priority queue (which surprised me, i dc'ed from one game in like the first time in over month from what i remember) and ended up getting the 20 min wait which i thought was a little harsh since i hadn't been in it for a while. i actually checked last time i was in lower que and it was 6 months ago, i thought i would have at least been put back in to the 5 min bracket by now. 

has the rules changed on this matter or have i always just been misinformed about the fact that it doesn't go down?

replies.body: it takes more than a month to go back to normal, i think its 3 months

I believe it may actually be a full year for leaver buster but don't quote me on that. It could be about 6 months and you just got really unlucky. As far as I know it does go down but it takes a REALLY long time.

This has nothing to do with anything.

However my friend is constantly in low-priority queues. I don't think there is a single game he hasn't AFK'ed in at some point for more then 5 mins :D
The system is broken and they don't want to admit it....
